name: America's Army 3
description: Download AA3 Today and Become a Member of the elite America's Army Team! America's Army fans and new players alike can now experience America's Army 3, the official U.S. Army game.
minimum_requirements: Supported OS: Microsoft® Windows® XP SP2/Vista                      Processor: 3.0 GHz Single Core                      Memory: 1 GB RAM                     Graphics: Direct X 9.0c compliant, Shader 3.0 enabled video card with 256MB RAM (NVIDIA 6600 or better/ATI X1300 or better)                      DirectX Version: DirectX 9.0c                      Sound: Direct X 9.0c compliant sound card                      Hard Drive: 5 GB of Available Hard Disk Space Input: Keyboard and mouse Multiplayer: Broadband Internet connection
recommended_requirements: Supported OS: Microsoft® Windows® XP SP2/Vista                      Processor: 2.4 GHz Dual Core                      Memory: 2 GB RAM                     Graphics: Direct X 9.0c compliant, Shader 3.0 enabled video card with 512MB RAM (NVIDIA 7950 or better/ATI X1950 or better)                      DirectX Version: DirectX 9.0c                      Sound: Creative EAX 4.0 compliant sound card (Audigy 2, X-Fi series)                      Hard Drive: 5 GB of Available Hard Disk Space   Input: Keyboard and mouse Multiplayer: Broadband Internet connection

reviews.review_text: By no means is this 'the best FPS ever', but you will be hard pressed to find a more realistic shooter. The physics are realistic, weapons are not one-shot death-lasers, and if you want any medical attention you will need to emphasize teamwork. But probably the best thing about the game is the oddly mature community! I can't remember ever being trolled or cussed out...Call of Duty kids must not know this game exists.

it is pretty good back then, but now community is dead :C  >be a medic during a attack on the enemy base >we have to cross a bridge >epicattack.exe >people get shot all around me >i tend to the first guy next to me >'tell me wife... i love her' >i tell him 'Nah mate you will tell her yourself!' >he begins to fade  >'HANG IN THERE MATE' i shout at him >Commander shouts over radio 'PULL BACK DAMMIT' >i call back on the radio 'There is still people out here!' >He responds 'its too late, so pull back Now!' >i run away from the dying soldier  >he looks at me and tells me 'remember what i told you....' >he dies right there.  To this day i still haven't told his wife that he loved her 10/10 would not tell again

The money wasted to make this game could have been better spent treating vets in the VA. AA2 was rather solid and challenging if not a bit unrealistic in many respects, however it was a superior product over this.
Nice and Free Game!
- Try to grab one of the Grenadier slots - Learn the bottlenecks every map has - Spam grenades until victorious

America's Army 3 requires tactics, intelligence and it puts you in various environments from open fields to narrow streets. The graphics aren't the best but what it lacks in graphics quality it makes up for in gameplay, its usually best to try and work as a team and try and work out a strategic route with your fellow teammates. Overall America's Army 3 is a really great game! the graphics aren't the cleanest but the gameplay is very fun and very tatical for any gamers that want a change from Call Of Duty or may not have the money for ArmA 3 I'd give this game 7.5/10 Definitely worth the download!

The game is fun, and the US Army developed and sponsors the games, so that's something. The UI in the game is the biggest turn off for me, its generally terrible. If you can get past that however the game play can be tactical, and is almost always fun. Its for you to decide how much you will like the game, but I am here to say AA3 is worth your time to try.

I can't get to a server because of Punkbuster timing out, so I can't recommend it. Seems I'm not the only one, either.  EDIT: Well now I got the Punkbuster working after deleting local content of the game and reinstalling on a different drive. This time I used C: drive and the game started working. Will update later on the actual gameplay.

Good free game. Uses the UnReal engine so things look and play well.  AA2 was a recuitment game for the US military, and so is this - however it's not stressed 'JOIN THE ARMY'.  It's the 2nd best millitary sim I've seen (next to ARMA 2).  7/10

I would not recommend playing this game. It is a free to play game so the only thing you'll lose in time. It may be alright on its own merit, but I'm coming from the perspective of someone who played a lot of America's Army 2. If you're coming back to the franchise in hope that it will still be the a team based tatical shooter, you'll be disappointed. If you're just coming into the franchise now, you might like it. I think other shooters do it better even at this price point.  I will update this review to be more in-depth at a later time.

3/5  I give a lot of 3/5s.  its a nice middle score for games that dont stand out to me, but aren't terrible. Thats what America's army 3 is. Its got a lot of realism going for it, which is nice, but what it lacks is CONTENT. theres a few maps, and like 2 guns max per class, with like one modification. theres a bit of a lag issue sometimes, might just be me, but usually is quite smooth and good. The graphics are somewhat decent, and the game has many unimplemented features in training. However, the single player is very good at teaching you the basic and the advanced parts of the game, no matter what role you play. If realism beyond visuals is your thing, then I recommend this game. Fun to play with friends and very tactically oriented. 7/10

America's Army 3 doesn't have typical gameplay from normal first-person shooters such as the Call of Duty series. It's more difficult to charge in head-on to the enemy as your body armor can only take 1-2 shots before being broken and leaving yourself unprotected. The use of cover is one of the many things that will save you when playing this game, and it slows down the pace of the game itself as you have to move from cover to cover, suppress the enemy, deploy smoke, etc.... For a newcomer to America's Army 3, I would recommend going over the training courses before stepping into a pvp match because the controls are a bit complicated. The one thing that I hope would be fixed on here is the introduction of new weapons and a better class system because there are far too many times that every match I go in, people tend to choose the Squad Designated Marksman role and the only ones left are the rifleman, grenadier, and automatic rifleman.

This free game has been brought to you by the propaganda machine of the US Army! It's a realistic game that has its ups and downs. Its ups include realism, forced teamwork and ranking system. Its downs include long respawn times. I mean like... loooooooong...... like... go make a sandwich, eat it while watching TV, go take a dump and then come back to the computer long.

America's Army 3 overall was an enjoyable experience, for the most part. Sometimes I would find myself getting annoyed by the small glitches and the bugs, but the other half of the time the game bled its true colors and showed potential. In fact, AA3 has a lot of potential, and with a few coding fixes the game could be really enjoyable. The achievement system makes you come back for more, and that is what will make me come back and play this even more. For a free game, AA3 is good, but it could be great. If you are looking for something new to play or you want something that provides a real world perspective, AA3 should be on your list. I would love to see an update or patch for this game, but in the meantime I'll just laugh it off with my teammates.

this game is definitly worth getting if you enjoy tactical realism games. the gameplay is amazing ( having to go through training to use certain weapons) and i enjoyed the 'tacitcal' aspest of squad movements. bullet drop is applied to every shot as well as combat life saver ( CLS) techniques.   i wish that AA4 was more like this but its not. this is still one of the best representations of actual military operations that i've found in the past decade of tactical gaming.
For it's time, this was a really fun game. Reminds me a lot of the ARMA series. I would buy this if you are looking for a FPS to get into on your free-time.
